description: '''The Boomtown Rats''' are  an Irish [[rock music|rock]]/[[New wave music|new wave]] band originally formed in Dublin in 1975. Between 1977 and 1985, they had a series of Irish and UK [[hit record|hits]] including "[[Like Clockwork]]", "[[Rat Trap]]", "[[I Don't Like Mondays]]" and "[[Banana Republic (song)|Banana Republic]]". The original line-up comprised six musicians; five from [[DÃºn Laoghaire]] in [[County Dublin]]; [[Gerry Cott]] (rhythm guitar), [[Simon Crowe]] (drums), [[Johnnie Fingers]] (keyboards), [[Bob Geldof]] (vocals) and [[Garry Roberts]] (lead guitar), plus Fingers' cousin [[Pete Briquette]] (bass). The Boomtown Rats broke up in 1986, but reformed in 2013, without Fingers or Cott. Garry Roberts died in 2022. The band's fame and notability have been overshadowed by the charity work of [[frontman]] Bob Geldof.
